csw.services.events

Interface EventService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EventServiceImpl

    public interface EventService
    The interface of a key value store.

    • Method Detail

      • subscribe

        EventService.EventMonitor subscribe(akka.actor.ActorRef subscriber,
                                    boolean postLastEvents,
                                    java.lang.String... prefixes)
        Subscribes an actor to events matching the given prefixes. Each prefix may be followed by a '*' wildcard to subscribe to all matching events. An actor is created to manage the subscriptions and the EventMonitor return value can be used to stop the actor or change the prefixes subscribed to.

        Parameters:
        subscriber - an actor to receive Event messages
        postLastEvents - if true, the subscriber receives the last known values of any subscribed events first
        prefixes - one or more prefixes of events, may include wildcard
        Returns:
        an object containing an actorRef that can be used to subscribe and unsubscribe or stop the actor

      • subscribe

        EventService.EventMonitor subscribe(scala.Function1<Events.EventServiceEvent,scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> callback,
                                    boolean postLastEvents,
                                    java.lang.String... prefixes)
        Subscribes a callback function to events matching the given prefixes. Each prefix may be followed by a '*' wildcard to subscribe to all matching events. An actor is created to manage the subscriptions and the EventMonitor return value can be used to stop the actor or change the prefixes subscribed to.

        Parameters:
        callback - an callback which will be called with Event objects (in another thread)
        postLastEvents - if true, the callback receives the last known values of any subscribed events first
        prefixes - one or more prefixes of events, may include wildcard
        Returns:
        an object containing an actorRef that can be used to subscribe and unsubscribe or stop the actor

      • publish

        scala.concurrent.Future<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> publish(Events.EventServiceEvent event)
        Publishes the given event

        Parameters:
        event - the event to publish
        Returns:
        the future result (indicates if and when the operation completed, may be ignored)

      • subscribe

        EventService.EventMonitor subscribe(akka.actor.ActorRef subscriber,
                                    boolean postLastEvents,
                                    scala.collection.Seq<java.lang.String> prefixes)
        Subscribes an actor to events matching the given prefixes. Each prefix may be followed by a '*' wildcard to subscribe to all matching events. An actor is created to manage the subscriptions and the EventMonitor return value can be used to stop the actor or change the prefixes subscribed to.

        Parameters:
        subscriber - an actor to receive Event messages
        postLastEvents - if true, the subscriber receives the last known values of any subscribed events first
        prefixes - one or more prefixes of events, may include wildcard
        Returns:
        an object containing an actorRef that can be used to subscribe and unsubscribe or stop the actor

      • subscribe

        EventService.EventMonitor subscribe(scala.Function1<Events.EventServiceEvent,scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> callback,
                                    boolean postLastEvents,
                                    scala.collection.Seq<java.lang.String> prefixes)
        Subscribes a callback function to events matching the given prefixes. Each prefix may be followed by a '*' wildcard to subscribe to all matching events. An actor is created to manage the subscriptions and the EventMonitor return value can be used to stop the actor or change the prefixes subscribed to.

        Parameters:
        callback - an callback which will be called with Event objects (in another thread)
        postLastEvents - if true, the callback receives the last known values of any subscribed events first
        prefixes - one or more prefixes of events, may include wildcard
        Returns:
        an object containing an actorRef that can be used to subscribe and unsubscribe or stop the actor

      • createEventMonitor

        EventService.EventMonitor createEventMonitor(akka.actor.ActorRef subscriber,
                                             boolean postLastEvents)
        Creates an EventMonitorActor and subscribes the given actor to it. The return value can be used to stop the actor or subscribe and unsubscribe to events.

        Parameters:
        subscriber - an actor to receive Event messages
        postLastEvents - if true, the subscriber receives the last known values of any subscribed events first
        Returns:
        an object containing an actorRef that can be used to subscribe and unsubscribe or stop the actor

      • createEventMonitor

        EventService.EventMonitor createEventMonitor(scala.Function1<Events.EventServiceEvent,scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> callback,
                                             boolean postLastEvents)
        Creates an EventMonitorActor and subscribes the given actor to it. The return value can be used to stop the actor or subscribe and unsubscribe to events.

        Parameters:
        callback - an callback which will be called with Event objects (in another thread)
        postLastEvents - if true, the callback receives the last known values of any subscribed events first
        Returns:
        an object containing an actorRef that can be used to subscribe and unsubscribe or stop the actor
